Function Documentation

function Behavior (   productID  ) 

Whether to ajax-send behavior info in certain interval Behavior#INFO_INTERVAL.

How often to send the info by ajax (in miliseconds).

Whether behavior has been sent from this page. Used not to increment display count when behavior info is not sent for the first time, so that this only makes sense when SEND_INFO_OFTEN is set to true.

Whether to save behavior to cookies. At least on of SEND_INFO_OFTEN or USE_BEHAVIOR_COOKIES should be used, USE_BEHAVIOR_COOKIES is recommended.

Whether to send info when onUnload event is fired.

How often to save behavior cookies (in miliseconds).

Pointer to cookies saving interval function.

Maximum time user is expected to view the page. No bigger values are sent to the server as behavior.

ID of current product.

Total amount of pixels user scrolled by.

Last position of content in the window. Used to count amount of scrolling.

Number of mouse clicks user does.

Last time page was focused.

Total time the page has been focused.

Whether the window is focused right now.

Whether the page is saved to bookmarks. This is not used now, there is no way to find this out using javascript.

Total amount of pixels user moved mouse by. Not used now, because mouse moving is not too relevant behavior. But maybe this would be able to tell whether user really sits in front of PC and reads the page.

Definition at line 51 of file main.js.

post ( 'php/ajax/changePrefType.php'   ) 
function postData (   address,
  parameters 
)

Main script that contains all classes, should be included in every page.

This script creates BehaviorCookies and LoginForm automatically because this is what every page needs. Posts data to server using http POST. Creates and submits a html form to do this. Usual use when a hyperlink doing POST is needed.

Parameters:
{String} address Address to send POST request to
{Array} parameters Array of values indexed by names

Variable Documentation

PageNumbers prototype checkBorders
Initial value:
 function(){
    if (this.pageNumbers.scrollLeft() == 0){
        this.toLeft.css('visibility', 'hidden');
        this.toBeginning.css('visibility', 'hidden');
    }else{
        this.toLeft.css('visibility', 'visible');
        this.toBeginning.css('visibility', 'visible');
    }
    if (this.pageNumbers[0].clientWidth >= this.pageNumbers[0].scrollWidth ||
            this.pageNumbers[0].scrollWidth == this.pageNumbers.scrollLeft() + this.pageNumbers[0].clientWidth){
        this.toRight.css('visibility', 'hidden');
        this.toEnd.css('visibility', 'hidden');
    }else{
        this.toRight.css('visibility', 'visible');
        this.toEnd.css('visibility', 'visible');
    }
}

Checks whether to hide or show buttons for scrolling.

The visibility css property instead of display css property is toggled. There could also be a checkFutureBorders function which will hide/show buttons before animation and not after.

Definition at line 727 of file main.js.

Behavior prototype countDisplayTime

Counts Behavior#displayTime from Behavior#focused and Behavior#timeFocused.

Maximum display time restriction is applied.

Definition at line 483 of file main.js.

BehaviorCookies get
Initial value:
 function(){
    var productID = $.cookie('productID');
    if (productID != null && productID != '' && productID > 0){
        return {"productID" : productID,
                "scrollCount" : $.cookie('scrollCount'),
                "clickCount" : $.cookie('clickCount'),
                "displayTime" : $.cookie('displayTime'),
                "displayCount" : $.cookie('displayCount')};
    }
    return null;
}

Returns behavior cookies as a json object.

Returns:
Json object or null if cookies don't exist

Definition at line 116 of file main.js.

BehaviorCookies remove
Initial value:
 function(){
    $.cookie('productID', null);
    $.cookie('scrollCount', null);
    $.cookie('clickCount', null);
    $.cookie('displayTime', null);
    $.cookie('displayCount', null);    
}

Deletes behavior cookies.

CartControls prototype sendChange

Sends item's quantity change to the server and changes the cart table appropriately.

Parameters:
{Object} button Button that fired the event (removal or quantity change)
{int} quantity Desired quantity of the item (removal = 0)

Definition at line 822 of file main.js.

BehaviorCookies set
Initial value:
 function(productID, scrollCount, clickCount, displayTime,
                                displayCount){

    
    var cookieLifeTime = 30;

    $.cookie('productID', productID, {'expires': cookieLifeTime});
    $.cookie('scrollCount', scrollCount, {'expires': cookieLifeTime});
    $.cookie('clickCount', clickCount, {'expires': cookieLifeTime});
    $.cookie('displayTime', displayTime, {'expires': cookieLifeTime});
    $.cookie('displayCount', displayCount, {'expires': cookieLifeTime});
}

Sets behavior cookies to specified values.

Saves them for one month (when user closes browser or navigates to different domain, cookies are kept and sent when user gets to this application again).

Definition at line 99 of file main.js.

CartControls prototype startLoading
Initial value:
 function(){
    this.rightButton.hide();
    this.loading.show();
}

Displays the loading image and hides the Submit button.

Definition at line 878 of file main.js.

CartControls prototype stopLoading
Initial value:
 function(){
    this.loading.hide();
    this.rightButton.show();
}

Displays the Submit button and hides the loading image.
